original_title: Health Ministry settles Rs. 120 mn in dues to CEB
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's Health Ministry said that a decision was made to immediately settle the pending the payments for the supply of electricity to hospitals, and health institutions, as well as for maintenance operations.

Health Secretary Janaka Sri Chandragupta speaking to News 1st said that steps were taken to make a payment of Rs. 120 Million for electricity and maintainance at the Colombo National Hospital to the CEB.
He noted that the Treasury had agreed to settle the remaining dues.
The Ceylon Electricity Board said Sri Lankan hospitals, and health institutions owe a sum of approximately Rs. 3 billion for the supply of electricity.
CEB General Manager Rohan Seneviratne said that the relevant bills should be settled via the Health Ministry directly with the Ceylon Electricity Board.
The Ceylon Electricity Board said that the Colombo National Hospital has unsettled bills spanning across five months to the tune of Rs. 339 million.
The CEB had informed the Colombo National Hospital to settle the payment.
The CEB General Manager however said that the supply of electricity will not be suspended for hospitals that do not make the payments.
